keyword: how many calories in a dirty martini
title: How Many Calories in a Dirty Martini?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a dirty martini, including carbs, sodium from brine, alcohol content, and variations for your cocktail nutrition.
h1: How Many Calories in a Dirty Martini?
assumptions: Standard recipe: 2.5 oz gin or vodka, 0.5 oz dry vermouth, 0.5 oz olive brine, garnished with 1-2 olives; shaken with ice.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brands, pour sizes, and garnishes. Alcohol content affects calories; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard dirty martini contains about 250 kcal, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a dirty martini?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard serving.

faqs.q: What makes a dirty martini higher in sodium?
faqs.a: The olive brine adds about 450 mg sodium per drink.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a dirty martini?
faqs.a: Yes, around 2.5 g, mainly from vermouth.

faqs.q: How does a dirty martini compare to a dry martini in calories?
faqs.a: A dry version (no brine) has about 10 fewer calories, around 240 kcal.

faqs.q: Does the type of alcohol affect calories in a dirty martini?
faqs.a: Gin and vodka have similar calories; substitutions like rum would increase them.
